How We Get Brainwashed!




I could not find a thread on brainwashing. Accusations of being brainwashed are coming across every so often at this board. Therefore I thought it good to start a discussion on brainwashing.
Giving cases and examples of brainwashing, and how we can become victims of brainwashing, and the exploration of the various angles of brainwashing, its subtleties, just anything that has to do with brainwashing would be suitable for this thread. 
Who brainwashes us and why? Quotes on brainwashing. Who is brainwashed and how can somebody snap out of a state of being brainwashed?
Do you remember a time when you were brainwashed, and do you remember who did it to you and how you snapped out of it? 
I think this could not only make for an interesting discussion but also for an educational and healing one.
---
Influencing public behavior so that the elite achieves its political goals is the most common form of brainwashing. Would the elite hesitate to use all available techniques to exploit us through brainwashing?
We understand the use of the mass media to brainwash us, but would the elite be the cause of persisting social crises as well? Is creative destruction a tool of brainwashing and is it being used?
Is sports on TV and radio being used as a tool to keep us docile? If the masses think too much, that could get dangerous to the system, and therefore great importance is put on meaningless distraction. 
Slogans, what are the slogans which are being used to brainwash us and how do these slogans harm us?
Why do our politicians lie so much? Is their lying is central to the survival of their goals?
I will leave it here and hope that you find this discussion stimulating.

Re: How We Get Brainwashed!


Everything about TV programming is designed to make entire populations become docile, servile, essentially prisoners in their own homes. I threw mine out months ago and have never felt better. The following highlights come from this article, which likens TV to a plug-in-drug, a deity in the corner of the room, and even a robot factory.
""Not unlike drugs and alcohol, TV watching allows the participant to blot out the real world and enter into a pleasurable and passive mental state, where worries and anxieties cannot intrude. The typically vacant stare of someone on drugs or alcohol is very similar to the stare of the TV watcher.""
""The brain is patterned by the senses, by movement, speech, thought and imagination. As the brain develops, children shift from a non-verbal right hemisphere dreaming consciousness to a verbal, logical left hemisphere state. Television watching prolongs childrens dependency on the right hemisphere.""
""Children develop their sense of identity, of saying I to themselves in meeting real people. The people on TV are unreal, impersonal images which do little or nothing to awaken a childs sense of self. Hence TV children may tend to relate to themselves and others as things, objects, tools, or even machines. This attitude may later develop into an inability to react constructively in social situations.""

Dr.	10/27/2007	9:56 PM	"


Re: How We Get Brainwashed!


I was once told by a professor that there are two main categories of techniques the media uses to influence people. I don't recall if there are technical terms for each of them. 
The first way is the ""direct"" approach whereby the TV ""tells people what the heck to do"", e.g., ""don't do drugs"", ""eat your vegetables"", ""marry Negroes"", etc. This approach is not very effective.
The other, indirect, approach is to constantly provide examples of other people behaving in a certain way. e.g., Blacks and Whites marrying, every show having main characters that are opposed to ""racism"", Black or Mexicans that behave as though they are good members of society or even that act much like Whites (e.g., The Jeffersons). This latter approach has been shown to be very effective.
In his 2005 EURO speech, Nick Griffin (the chairman of the BNP) made similar observations about the WN movement. Griffin said that the vast majority of people cannot wake up from something they read. Instead, they have to see others behaving in a certain way before they can accept a new way of thinking or behaving.
It is perhaps a sad commentary on the mindset of the common man, but as Griffin said, ""There you are."", i.e., it is a fact we have to accept.
That said, there are many, many people in our population who can be awoken by something they read or hear and we have to try to reach those first because we will need their help to get the numbers we'll need to implement the indirect approach (well, at least, outside of PLEs).

Teutonic Prince	10/28/2007	2:49 PM	"


Re: How We Get Brainwashed!


Ah, the ""brainwashing"" process, so simple, yet so misunderstood by the garden variety lemming.
A previous poster had mentioned ""conditioning,"" and that is what brainwashing comes down to, psychological conditioning.
Most of us know of Pavlov and his experiments with dogs. Pavlov gave a meat power to dogs paired with the ringing of a bell. As a physiological response the dogs would salivate when the meat powder was given. Over time, though, the dogs would also salivate with just the sound of the bell without the meat powder, and the dogs had learned to associate the two stimuli together. Pavlov also observed that over time when the bell was rung and the meat powder was no longer given the dogs would no longer salivate (extinction). This is what is called classical or Pavlovian conditioning.
Fast forward about 50 years or so, and we see Skinner's theory of ""Operant Conditioning."" Operant Conditioning is based on reinforcement and punishment, and here we get down to the nitty-gritty of how the brainwashing process begins.
We have positive reinforcement, negative reinforcement, positive punishment, and negative punishment---positive and negative not being in the sense ""good or bad,"" but in the sense of more add and subtract.
We also see Albert Bandura's theory of social/observational learning or ""modeling"" come in to play, which is pretty much common sense nowadays. We simply learn behaviors and shape our ideas by what we are exposed to.
So, if we apply operant conditioning in conjunction with observational learning, we can see how the masses get ""conditioned"" or ""brainwashed.""
It can start at home, but not necessarily, with liberal parents, who have been previously conditioned, who teach their children liberal values and ""positively reinforce"" anti-racism by simply adding a pleasant stimulus when a child exhibits the behavior, which could be as simply as ""Good boy/girl."" The parents also can positively punish (adding something unpleasant, like a stern lecture or spanking) or negatively punish (taking away something pleasurable, like toys) race favoritism, which most children naturally exhibit.
Society at large, especially at the institutional level also reinforce anti-racism and punish race favoritism, as we all know. At school, little Johnny gets great comments from his teacher and an A+ on his paper about Martin Luther King Jr., whereas little Timmy gets called to the principal's office, gets and F, and suspended for his paper questioning the validity of the Holocaust. Also, early on conditioning occurs, and we learn there can be an unpleasant social backlash for not being anti-racist or politically correct, so that anti-racist behavior is exhibited to avoid an unpleasant social response (negative reinforcement).
Now we get into the real kicker, the observational learning. Albeit, the reinforcement seems enough to effectively condition, but it is not. Just as in Pavlov's dogs, once the meat and bell were no longer paired together, the dogs quite salivating at the bell. The same occurs in operant conditioning as well when a behavior is no longer reinforced or punished. Us who have young kids know this well, and it doesn't take long. If you let your kids get away with something a couple of times that you have taught them not to do and usually punish them for, and it will be like they never knew the rule.
This is where the media comes in. We pass through schools, move away from our parents', and move from social situation to social situation, but the ever-looming presence of the media and pop-culture is always there. Here, we see movies, TV shows, news broadcasts, music, magazines, etc, all cementing into place the liberal, anti-racist, multicultural, politically correct, miscegenation-promoting agenda of the Jew.
Notice, too, the psychologists (Pavlov, Skinner, and Bandura) who came up with these theories were all White men, non-Jews. At the time Skinner's theories were presented, his more harsh critics were Jews. Could it be possible the Jews in their never ceasing psy-ops attempts already knew the power of conditioning and were attempting to discredit and/or silence Skinner?

How can we guard ourselves against brainwashing. We cannot avoid conditioning, because it always surrounds us, the Liberals make sure of that. Their comments and influence are everywhere, all the time.

Determine who the enemy is and consider the methods this enemy may be using to gain your trust and shape your opinion.
Many times brainwashing as a tool exploits people's virtues such as generosity, pity, and benevolence. We want to do what is right and unsuspectingly we open the door to the foe and work his will.
We have been brainwashed into working hard, paying taxes, and not to overpopulate our planet. While we whites were obedient sheep, we were outnumbered swiftly by non-whites who had no such concerns and who were too often helped out with our tax money. Before we knew it they invaded our lands and are in the process of taking over. All of this was done while we were told and believed that our actions were good. After that came the adoptions of non-white babies from other lands by whites in our nations. If there ever is a law in the country which forces us to believe something, we know automatically that what they tell us is not true!
One thing I discovered is that I always and without exception made a regrettable mistake if I did not follow my own instincts and allowed others to change my mind in a number of matters. So I think that always following your own instincts is one way to steer clear of brainwashing by the establishment.

Here are some comments on brainwashing which got me to think.
Mentioned are four basic tactics used to achieve mind control and allow for an individuals identity to be systematically manipulated and changed. These four things are remembered with the acronym BITE, and are behavior, information, thoughts and emotions.
Quote:

Behavior control starts with one persons regulation of another individuals physical reality. Our physical reality means the clothes we wear, the food we eat, the amount of sleep we get, how we spend our time and how we spend our money. There are rigid rules and regulations the controlled person is supposed to abide by regarding these. Over time, this behavior control fosters dependency. The controlled person gets used to not behaving autonomously.

Behavior control starts in childhood and is shared first by parents, then by the school system, and unfortunately, also by the invention of Television. Children are expected to conform.
The ""go along to get along"" advice sounds great in a morally civilized society, but unfortunately for us whites such a society lies in the past. It probably never existed in some places and was more likely concentrated in rural villages and towns. 
I think that parents of today should teach their children to become individuals, to be different when necessary, even if that means that the other children ridicule or bully them. Teaching children self-defence and taking them to marshall arts classes should bolster their self image. I tried to teach my sons that way and one of them was not all that appreciative of it until he grew up and realized the advantages he had gained over his peers.
I will try to continue this later.

Re: How We Get Brainwashed!




Quote:


Originally Posted by Dr. Ford


I was once told by a professor that there are two main categories of techniques the media uses to influence people. I don't recall if there are technical terms for each of them. 
The first way is the ""direct"" approach whereby the TV ""tells people what the heck to do"", e.g., ""don't do drugs"", ""eat your vegetables"", ""marry Negroes"", etc. This approach is not very effective.
The other, indirect, approach is to constantly provide examples of other people behaving in a certain way. e.g., Blacks and Whites marrying, every show having main characters that are opposed to ""racism"", Black or Mexicans that behave as though they are good members of society or even that act much like Whites (e.g., The Jeffersons). This latter approach has been shown to be very effective.
In his 2005 EURO speech, Nick Griffin (the chairman of the BNP) made similar observations about the WN movement. Griffin said that the vast majority of people cannot wake up from something they read. Instead, they have to see others behaving in a certain way before they can accept a new way of thinking or behaving.
It is perhaps a sad commentary on the mindset of the common man, but as Griffin said, ""There you are."", i.e., it is a fact we have to accept.
That said, there are many, many people in our population who can be awoken by something they read or hear and we have to try to reach those first because we will need their help to get the numbers we'll need to implement the indirect approach (well, at least, outside of PLEs).



Exactly!! Take Hollywood movies for instance, they make a movie where a black is always more intelligent and plays the role of the white guy's boss for instance. The black is usually portrayed as superior morally and intellectually and the white guy in need of the black guy's guidance support whatever. 
The idea is to create a FAKE reality for children that they totally embrace as truth. So in the back of their heads they leave the movie theatre believing that blacks are morally and intellectually superior to them, even if this fake ""knowledge"" is still merely the germ of an idea. Later ""knowledge"" in the form of more movies or conditioning by college professors etc, do the trick. and we have a white lemming.

Re: How We Get Brainwashed!


Jews have researched ways and means of conditioning the masses for a long time. The Radio Project funded by Rockefeller was one such undertaking. The Milgram experiment is another, Milgram was a jewish psychologist who experimented on his students to see how far people will go in inflicting pain on their peers in order to obey what they thought was a ""authority figure"".
Quote:

The legal and philosophic aspects of obedience are of enormous importance, but they say very little about how most people behave in concrete situations. I set up a simple experiment at Yale University to test how much pain an ordinary citizen would inflict on another person simply because he was ordered to by an experimental scientist. Stark authority was pitted against the subjects' [participants'] strongest moral imperatives against hurting others, and, with the subjects' [participants'] ears ringing with the screams of the victims, authority won more often than not. The extreme willingness of adults to go to almost any lengths on the command of an authority constitutes the chief finding of the study and the fact most urgently demanding explanation.


Now today of course Jews are in many positions of authority over us so I think it's obvious to see the implications.
Here is some links to information about the ""Milgram experiment""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milgram_experimenthttp://www.age-of-the-sage.org/psych...xperiment.html

The video ""The Century of Self"" (which I need to watch in full)
[ame=""http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-2637635365191428174&q=century+of+self&total=1084&s tart=0&num=10&so=0&type=search&plindex=1""]The Century of the Self[/ame]
mentions about how corporations undertook the task of changing peoples' buying habits from buying only what they needed to buying what they wanted. The video itself should be watched regarding the subject of brainwashing.
It is interesting in and of itself that today's modern consumerist mentality is normal and seems normal. We are not shocked by someone buying something just because they want it. Evidently, this is a major change from the mind-set of our forefathers.
But regarding being happy, we are tempted with things and experiences shown on television and magazines, and I can't begin to think of an ad that doesn't sell us on the expectation that we'll be happier with it. 
Another thing the first video says is that the more options we have, the less happy we tend to be. More is less. So, we've gone from a society where only men go out to work while women remain ""stuck"" at home, to a society where women are liberated and now the family can buy more things to have a better life. But we aren't happier. We have more things and less time; more money and less freedom; bigger houses but smaller families, if any at all. And we don't really interact with each other anymore (internet forums aside). We are less informed, debt-ridden, chasing after vain pleasures which do not give happiness, and only vaguely aware of the world around us. And generally, I think, unhappy.
Who benefits? We are stupid consumers who don't know what's going on and don't care too much, thinking we're chasing happiness which in reality can't obtain by the chase. Who can move in secretly while we are in this self-induced daze? And we're generally so dependent on that next paycheck and being able to go buy what we need from the stores, we know we can't rock the boat to much. Ouch. I think we're stuck in the mud.
Have we been brainwashed more than we realize? Have we given up happiness to chase vanities on the treadmill driving the commercial machineries which make only the money powers rich? And given up our power by neglect, leaving it to others?

ManifestDestiny	11/16/2007	3:14 AM	"


Re: How We Get Brainwashed!


Here is a list of techniques used on us by the media to manufacture consent for their master's schemes. In classical academia many of these were called the ""logical fallacies"":
Argumentum ad Hominem: The attacking of an opponent's character, as opposed to attacking their arguments.
Argumentum ad nauseam: This argument approach uses tireless repetition of an idea. An idea, especially a simple slogan, that is repeated enough times, may begin to be taken as the truth. This approach works best when media sources are limited and controlled by the propagator. Often found as corporate jingles. (e.g. Head-On)
Appeal to authority: Citation of prominent figures to support a position, idea, argument, or course of action.
Appeal to fear: Seeking to build support by instilling anxieties and panic.
Appeal to Prejudice: Using loaded or emotive terms to attach value or moral goodness to believing the proposition.
Black-and-White fallacy: Presenting only two choices, with the product or idea being propagated as the better choice. (e.g., ""You are either with us, or against us"")
Beautiful people: The type of propaganda that deals with famous people or depicts attractive, happy people. This makes other people think that if they buy a product or follow a certain ideology, they too will be happy or successful.
Big Lie: The repeated articulation of a complex of events that justify subsequent action. The descriptions of these events have elements of truth, and the ""big lie"" generalizations merge and eventually supplant the public's accurate perception of the underlying events.
Common man: This approach attempts to convince the audience that the propagandist's positions reflect the common sense of the folk. It is designed to win the confidence of the audience by communicating in the common manner and style of the target audience. Propagandists use ordinary language and mannerisms (and clothe their message in face-to-face and audiovisual communications) in attempting to identify their point of view with that of the average person. For example, a propaganda leaflet may make an argument on a macroeconomic issue, such as unemployment insurance benefits, using everyday terms: ""given that the country has little money during this recession, we should stop paying unemployment benefits to those who do not work, because that is like maxing out all your credit cards during a tight period, when you should be tightening your belt.""
Demonizing the enemy: Making individuals from the opposing nation, from a different ethnic group, or those who support the opposing viewpoint appear to be subhuman, worthless, or immoral, through suggestion or false accusations.
Join the crowd: This technique is used to convince the audience that a program is an expression of an irresistible mass movement and that by joining they can express their commitment to populism.
Inevitable-victory: This technique works off of people's natural desire to be on the winning side. Appeals made to persuade the target audience to join in the spoils of victory by taking the course of action that ""everyone else is taking.""
Direct order: This technique hopes to simplify the decision making process by using images and words to tell the audience exactly what actions to take, eliminating any other possible choices. Authority figures can be used to give the order, overlapping it with the Appeal to authority technique, but not necessarily. The Uncle Sam ""I want you"" image is an example of this technique.
Euphoria: The use of an event that generates euphoria or happiness, or using an appealing event to boost morale. Euphoria can be created by declaring a holiday, making luxury items available, or mounting a military parade with marching bands and patriotic messages.
Disinformation: The creation or deletion of information from public records, in the purpose of making a false record of an event or the actions of a person or organization, including outright forgery of photographs, motion pictures, broadcasts, and sound recordings as well as printed documents.
Flag-waving: An attempt to justify an action on the grounds that doing so will make one more patriotic, or in some way benefit a group, country, or idea. The feeling of patriotism which this technique attempts to inspire may not necessarily diminish or entirely omit one's capability for rational examination of the matter in question.


"																								
ManifestDestiny	11/16/2007	3:24 AM	"


Re: How We Get Brainwashed!


Glittering generalities: Glittering generalities are emotionally appealing words applied to a product or idea, but which present no concrete argument or analysis. A famous example is the campaign slogan ""Ford has a better idea!""
Intentional vagueness: Generalities are deliberately vague so that the audience may supply its own interpretations. The intention is to move the audience by use of undefined phrases, without analyzing their validity or attempting to determine their reasonableness or application. The intent is to cause people to draw their own interpretations rather than simply being presented with an explicit idea. In trying to ""figure out"" the propaganda, the audience forgoes judgment of the ideas presented. Their validity, reasonableness and application may still be considered.Reductio ad Hitlerum: This technique is used to persuade a target audience to disapprove of an action or idea by suggesting that the idea is popular with groups hated, feared, or held in contempt by the target audience. Thus if a group which supports a certain policy is led to believe that undesirable, subversive, or contemptible people support the same policy, then the members of the group may decide to change their original position.
Oversimplification: Favorable generalities are used to provide simple answers to complex social, political, economic, or military problems.
Quotes out of Context: Selective editing of quotes which can change meanings. Political documentaries designed to discredit an opponent or an opposing political viewpoint often make use of this technique.
Rationalization: Individuals or groups may use favorable generalities to rationalize questionable acts or beliefs. Vague and pleasant phrases are often used to justify such actions or beliefs.
Red herring/Chewbacca Defense: Presenting data or issues that, while compelling, are irrelevant to the argument at hand, and then claiming that it validates the argument.
Scapegoating: Assigning blame to an individual or group, thus alleviating feelings of guilt from responsible parties and/or distracting attention from the need to fix the problem for which blame is being assigned.
Slogans: A slogan is a brief, striking phrase that may include labeling and stereotyping. Although slogans may be enlisted to support reasoned ideas, in practice they tend to act only as emotional appeals. Opponents of the US's invasion and occupation of Iraq use the slogan ""blood for oil"" to suggest that the invasion and its human losses was done to access Iraq's oil riches. On the other hand, ""hawks"" who argue that the US should continue to fight in Iraq use the slogan ""cut and run"" to suggest that it would be cowardly or weak to withdraw from Iraq. Similarly, the names of the military campaigns, such as ""enduring freedom"" or ""just cause"", may also be regarded to be slogans, devised to influence people.
Stereotyping or Name Calling or Labeling: This technique attempts to arouse prejudices in an audience by labeling the object of the propaganda campaign as something the target audience fears, hates, loathes, or finds undesirable. For instance, reporting on a foreign country or social group may focus on the stereotypical traits that the reader expects, even though they are far from being representative of the whole country or group; such reporting often focuses on the anecdotal. (e.g. ""Islamo-fascism"")
Testimonial: Testimonials are quotations, in or out of context, especially cited to support or reject a given policy, action, program, or personality. The reputation or the role (expert, respected public figure, etc.) of the individual giving the statement is exploited. The testimonial places the official sanction of a respected person or authority on a propaganda message. This is done in an effort to cause the target audience to identify itself with the authority or to accept the authority's opinions and beliefs as its own.
Transfer: Also known as Association, this is a technique of projecting positive or negative qualities (praise or blame) of a person, entity, object, or value (an individual, group, organization, nation, patriotism, etc.) to another to make the second more acceptable or to discredit it. It evokes an emotional response, which stimulates the target to identify with recognized authorities. Often highly visual, this technique often utilizes symbols (for example, the Swastika used in Nazi Germany, originally a symbol for health and prosperity) superimposed over other visual images.
Unstated assumption: This technique is used when the propaganda concept that the propagandist intends to transmit would seem less credible if explicitly stated. The concept is instead repeatedly assumed or implied. (e.g. The Cosby Show)
Virtue words: These are words in the value system of the target audience which tend to produce a positive image when attached to a person or issue. Peace, happiness, security, wise leadership, freedom, ""The Truth"", etc. are virtue words. In countries such as the U.S. religiosity is seen as a virtue, making associations to this quality affectively beneficial. (e.g. Huckabee's use of the word ""honor"" when talking about staying in Iraq)

Re: How We Get Brainwashed!


Quote from http://readmylovestory.com/
THE GREAT PIRATES
Quote:

When I was twelve, R. Buckminster Fuller explained to me:
The great pirates, the traders and sea dwellers who needed men organized on land to expedite their trading created monarchies. Pirates were inherently outlaws.
Poker Without Cards: A Consciousness Thriller 
Pirates lived outside the system. The only laws that could, and did, rule them were natural laws. Pirates battled with one another to see who was going to control the vast sea routes and, eventually, the world. Their battles took place out of sight of land dwellers and the keepers of written history. The losers generally went to the bottom of the sea. Those who stayed on top of the waters, and prospered, did so because of their comprehensive abilities. They were the antithesis of specialists. 
Pirates were applied scientists. The wider and more long-distanced their anticipatory strategy, the more successful they usually were. Experience proved that multiple ships could outmaneuver one ship. So pirates created navies. 
Bucky pointed out that historians maintain that countries created naviesonly countries had the infrastructure to build and sustain navies. But, thats what our history tells us. But, history is simply a story agreed upon.
Bucky maintained that pirates created countries. Western civilization didnt just spring up simultaneously along different coasts. Trade prompted the development of countries. People were trading via shipping routes. Businessmen. Pirates.
Pirates created foci of power. To consistently sustain a navy, pirates had to control mines, forests, and lands to build the ships and establish the industries essential to building, supplying, and maintaining their navy. The pirates went to the various lands where they either acquired or sold goods, and picked the strongest man there to be the pirates local headman. The chosen man became the pirate's general manager of the local realm. 
If the chosen man in a given land had not already done so, the pirate told him to proclaim himself king. But this king was a stooge to commerce. His sole job was to maintain order on behalf of the pirates. Order was most easily maintained by having the local king proclaim that he was the headman of all men, the god-ordained ruler on earth. The locals werent traveling, so they saw no disparity. The pirates gave their stooge-kings secret lines of supplies that provided everything they needed to enforce their sovereign claim. The more massively bejeweled the king's gold crown, and the more visible his court and castle, the less visible was his pirate master.
Masters had to sleep occasionally, and therefore found it necessary to surround themselves with super-loyal, muscular, but dumb-as-****, illiterates, who couldnt see, nor savvy, their masters' strategies. There was great safety in the stupidity of these henchmen. The great pirates realized that the only people who could possibly contrive to displace them were the truly bright people. 
Secrecy was the pirates strongest defense. If the other powerful pirates didnt know where you were going, when youd gone, or when you were coming back, they wouldnt know how to waylay you. If anyone knew when you were coming home, small-timers could come out in small boats and waylay you in the dark and take you over, just before you got home tiredly after a two-year treasure-harvesting voyage. Hijacking and second-rate piracy became a popular activity around the world's shores and harbors. So, secrecy became the essence of the lives of the successful pirates. Thats why so little is known of these pirates.
These great pirates said to all their kings, statesmen who were functionally only lieutenants, ""Any time bright young people show up, I'd like to know about it, because we need bright men."" So, each time the pirate came into port, the local king would mention that he had some bright, young men whose capabilities and thinking shone out in the community. The great pirates would say to the king, ""All right, you summon them and deal with them as follows: As each young man is brought forward you say to him, 'Young man, you are very bright. I'm going to assign you to a great history tutor, and, in due course, if you study well and learn enough, I'm going to make you my Royal Historian, but you've got to pass many examinations given to you by me and your teacher.'"" And when the next bright boy was brought before him, the king was to say, ""I'm going to make you my Royal Treasurer,"" and so forth. Then the pirate said to the king, ""You will finally say to all of them: 'But each of you must mind your own business or off go your heads. I'm the only one who minds everybody's business.'""
And this is the way schools began, as royal tutorial schools. And, its the way specialization began. It is our current form of education. Academic education equals specialization. Exclusively, the great pirates retain comprehensive knowledge. Exclusively the great pirates, known today as businessmen, enjoy knowledge of the world through its resources. 
Bucky emphasized that this is not a metaphor or some kind of syllogism and that he was not being facetious. He held the pirate story as a more accurate history than found in traditional textbooks. 
This was the beginning of schools and colleges, and the beginning of intellectual specialization. The development of the bright ones into specialists gave the king very great brain power, and made him and his kingdom the most powerful in the land and, therefore, secretly and greatly advantaged his patron pirate in world competition with the other great pirates.
The power rested not with the power figureheads, the kings, but with the men behind the kings, the great pirates. Just as today, a corporate president may be the king, but the power is in the hands of the board of directorsthe ones never charged with corporate crimes.
Bucky saw our current world order as derived from deception and maintained through deception. Buckys key criticism of this deception is a perpetuated fallacy of scarcity. Scarcity is required to maintain the tension required for competition. It is intrinsic to the divide and conquer master strategy. However, most people are blind to the connection between competition and the divide and conquer strategy.

Re: How We Get Brainwashed!




Quote:


Originally Posted by Dr. Ford


I was once told by a professor that there are two main categories of techniques the media uses to influence people. I don't recall if there are technical terms for each of them. 
The first way is the ""direct"" approach whereby the TV ""tells people what the heck to do"", e.g., ""don't do drugs"", ""eat your vegetables"", ""marry Negroes"", etc. This approach is not very effective.
The other, indirect, approach is to constantly provide examples of other people behaving in a certain way. e.g., Blacks and Whites marrying, every show having main characters that are opposed to ""racism"", Black or Mexicans that behave as though they are good members of society or even that act much like Whites (e.g., The Jeffersons). This latter approach has been shown to be very effective.
In his 2005 EURO speech, Nick Griffin (the chairman of the BNP) made similar observations about the WN movement. Griffin said that the vast majority of people cannot wake up from something they read. Instead, they have to see others behaving in a certain way before they can accept a new way of thinking or behaving.
It is perhaps a sad commentary on the mindset of the common man, but as Griffin said, ""There you are."", i.e., it is a fact we have to accept.
That said, there are many, many people in our population who can be awoken by something they read or hear and we have to try to reach those first because we will need their help to get the numbers we'll need to implement the indirect approach (well, at least, outside of PLEs).


I couldn't agree more!

Xmarine20	11/24/2007	8:31 AM	"


Re: How We Get Brainwashed!


In the life of a nation, particularly this nation, so alive with energy and so eager to embrace the future, the passage of 25 years assures dynamic change.
From 1925 to 1950, the USA plunged from flapper-era prosperity into depression and war, only to emerge as a superpower and begin rebuilding a ravaged world. A harrowing Cold War with the Soviet Union and a divisive hot war in Vietnam dominated the next 25 years, but that period also saw America finally end legal discrimination against its long-oppressed black minority and we now know this was a Big Mistake.
Two Iraq wars, a stock market crash, the horror of 9/11 and other events have made our recent history traumatic, but viewed in retrospect, the great sweep of the past quarter-century can only be seen as an astounding period for human progress in the USA and abroad. 
The seemingly endless Cold War finally ended and the Soviet Union collapsed, setting free the imprisoned millions in Eastern Europe and igniting the fires of democracy elsewhere. The threat of nuclear Armageddon went the way of duck-and-cover drills.
At home, change has been no less startling. In 1982, much of the nation felt helpless  beset by ""malaise,"" as President Carter had put it a few years earlier. The worst recession since the Great Depression had left one-third of U.S. industrial capacity idle and sent unemployment up to 11%. The Dow Jones average sank to 776 a month before USA TODAY's debut. No one knew that was the bottom. Since then, the market has soared an astonishing eighteenfold, reflecting the longest run of economic growth in U.S. history.
Things that would have been viewed as luxuries, if not downright eccentric, a generation ago  $4 cups of coffee, cable television, brand-name bottled water, heated car seats and the like  are now viewed as necessities by millions in the middle class.
A blizzard of advances in medicine and technology  many of which don't easily lend themselves to daily headlines  has extended the lives of thousands and created a world of personalized communication never before known. The Internet, computers and cellphones have revolutionized life at the office and home. Just Wednesday, the Census Bureau announced that the average life expectancy for Americans is 77.9 years, the highest ever, up from 74.5 years in 1982. 
Lest we begin to sound Pollyannaish, it's important to note that all this progress has not brought peace, social equity or long-term prosperity for all. Our second quarter-century brings its own set of problems.
Islamic extremism has replaced communism as the biggest global threat. Iraq has become the latest Mideast quagmire for U.S. forces.Blacks and Mexicans are tarnishing this beautiful country...If anyone is to become an american citizen,They should be required to Learn English..And must say the Pledge of aligence..All illegals should be sent to Prison..Then Sent back to there country.
Globalization has helped keep prices low for U.S. consumers but left thousands of workers behind as manufacturing and service jobs have moved overseas. Income inequality is the most severe in nearly a century, with disturbing racial divisions. The percentage of households in poverty remains stuck at more than 12%, little improvement in 25 years. 
The number of people without health insurance keeps rising  now 47 million, according to new Census Bureau figures. A tsunami of rising costs for Social Security and health care poses a titanic threat to the nation's hard-earned prosperity, and attempts to address the issue responsibly are stalemated in a shortsighted battle of political ideologies.
On the cusp of the newspaper's second quarter-century, it is the last problem that is most disturbing.
Division and harsh argument  even violent confrontation  are nothing new. They course through our history. Further, free-spirited public debate is our way of identifying our problems and fixing them.
But at times of great challenge, leaders have managed to unify the nation to confront the onrushing threat, whether Depression or World War. One need only recall the days after 9/11 to know what that feels like.
These, too, are times of great challenge. From terrorists eager to present a new nuclear threat. From a rising world economy that assures change on a scale of the industrial revolution. From irresponsible elected officials too focused on short-term political advantage to address the fiscal crisis that they all acknowledge is coming.We tried getting all cultures together..It didn't work..Blacks want to be blacks..Not Americans...Mexicans want to fly there flag here in the States...Are these people Crazy?...There are going to be a few Mexicans with Flags up there Ass.
Our best guess is that 25 years from now, those challenges will have been met and conquered. To assume otherwise is to deny the nation's history. But as in the past, the ride will not be comfortable and will end happily only after political leaders look past divisions on lesser issues, tone down the politics of demonization and tackle the hard choices that lie ahead.

Psychological Operations or PSYOP are planned operations to convey selected information and indicators to audiences to influence their emotions, motives, objective reasoning, and ultimately the behavior of organizations, groups, and individuals. Used in all aspects of war, it is a weapon whose effectiveness is limited only by the ingenuity of the commander using it.
Psychological Operations (PSYOP) or Psychological Warfare (PSYWAR) is simply learning everything about your target enemy, their beliefs, likes, dislikes, strengths, weaknesses, and vulnerabilities. Once you know what motivates your target, you are ready to begin psychological operations.CONTINUED

Quote:

I read your piece over a few days and found myself immersed in your impressions, quite likely due to the similarities between our childhood perspectives. I presume that writing what you did must have been quite an experience for you, what was it that prompted you to share in such detail?
I myself am 27 years old and live in Canada. My grandfather who passed away several years ago was Russian and survived the gulags of Zionist Communism. Quote:


Originally Posted by Dr. Ford


I was once told by a professor that there are two main categories of techniques the media uses to influence people. I don't recall if there are technical terms for each of them. 
The first way is the ""direct"" approach whereby the TV ""tells people what the heck to do"", e.g., ""don't do drugs"", ""eat your vegetables"", ""marry Negroes"", etc. This approach is not very effective.
The other, indirect, approach is to constantly provide examples of other people behaving in a certain way. e.g., Blacks and Whites marrying, every show having main characters that are opposed to ""racism"", Black or Mexicans that behave as though they are good members of society or even that act much like Whites (e.g., The Jeffersons). This latter approach has been shown to be very effective.
In his 2005 EURO speech, Nick Griffin (the chairman of the BNP) made similar observations about the WN movement. Griffin said that the vast majority of people cannot wake up from something they read. Instead, they have to see others behaving in a certain way before they can accept a new way of thinking or behaving.
It is perhaps a sad commentary on the mindset of the common man, but as Griffin said, ""There you are."", i.e., it is a fact we have to accept.

Walter	1/4/2008	11:02 PM	"


The Stepford Whores: Project Monarch and Mind-Controlled Sex Slaves


http://tracyrtwyman.com/blog/?page_id=81
Quote:

It is well-known now in most literate circles, from declassified documents available through Freedom of Information Act, that the United States CIA engaged in a number of covert experiments in mind control, often on unwitting subjects, throughout the 50s, 60s, and 70s as part of a program known as MK-ULTRA. Thus, for example, we have the familiar stories of soldiers in Vietnam being subjected to involuntary testing of the effects of L.S.D. and other drugs on battlefield performance. MK-ULTRA had its roots in Project Paperclip, a port-WWII operation authorized by Harry Truman, in which top scientists from Nazi Germany were smuggled into the United States to work with NASA, the military, and the intelligence community. Their newly acquired knowledge of mind control techniques had come from their experiments on prisoners in Nazi concentration camps, in which, according to experts, they learned of the effects that the calculated use of torture, drugs, hypnotism, electroshock, and sleep deprivation could have on an individual personality. According to some, the result was found to be a fragmenting of the personality into separate components which are unaware of one another, creating what is known today as “Multiple Personality Disorder”, or by the more recent, clinically-accepted term, “Dissociative Identity Disorder.” The individual personality components could then be programmed to perform certain tasks, much like a computer. According to former FBI agent and mind control expert Ted Gunderson: “It’s a combination of torture, hypnosis, drugs. And what happens is, they torture them so much, that their personality splits in order to endure the pain and misery. When their personality splits, they became another person, and it’s through this technique that they train them.” Such techniques could, says Gunderson, create Manchurian candidates, unwitting agents of espionage who could commit assassinations, spy, and courier sensitive messages against their will and without any recollection of these events.

Skull and Bones, the Yale-based secret society that supplies the CIA with drug-runners, mind-rapists, child abusers and professional killers, requires neophytes to lie naked in a coffin and masturbate in front of older members while reciting the candidate's entire sexual history. This manipulation of shame has the added benefit of making psychopathic organizations effectively invisible to normal society. DragonMaster	2/10/2008	6:25 PM	"


Re: How We Get Brainwashed!


So in this article we read in psychology class, these judges and policemen were given videos of confessions to watch. They were supposed to decide whether or not they were voluntary. it gives these figures (this table is actually transposed and a total of policement and judges):Camera perspective|% of people thought confession is voluntarySuspect focus   |183Equal focus     |134Detective focus  |86Other than the fact that suspect focus is the most frequently used perspective when taping confessions, thereby creating the illusion of voluntariness in them, also the experiment gives these results:""Regardless of expert type, the suspect-focus version of the confession led to assessments of greater voluntariness than did the equal-focus and detective-focus versions, F(1, 39) = 4.80, p_rep = .93, d = 0.70. Ratings of the latter two versions did not differ significantly, t(39) = 1.06, p_rep = .77, d = 0.34.""* Now do you see anything wrong with this? Take a close look...*: the _ represents that the remainder of the word is subscript; quotation from ""Evaluating Videotaped Confessions"" by G. Daniel Lassiter, Shari Seidman Diamond, Heather C. Schmidt, and Jennifer K. Elek, in the journal of Psychological Science, Volume 18, Number 3, Page 224.Now, in class, I saw that inconsistency and pointed it out. The difference between the first and the second category is 49%; the different between the second and the third category is 48%. Therefore, the 1% difference probably did not make much of a difference. What was used to show that the first category had significantly more was the F test, and it compared all three to decide that the first one had more. What was used to show that the third category did not have significantly less was the t test, and it only compared the second and third categories. Were the tests reversed, the findings would be reversed. So we have one Jew in our class, and so as I'm telling this to the class, I look at him, and he's just sitting there glaring at me as hard as he can.  So yep, pay attention to statistics. Also, read some news to see how Ron Paul is just shunned by the media.

DragonMaster	2/10/2008	11:18 PM	"


Re: How We Get Brainwashed!


So basically, 184%-138%=49%, 138%-86%=48%, so basically difference between the suspect focus and equal focus is 49%; the difference between the equal focus and the detective focus is 48%; the F-test compared all three categories to decide that suspect focus has the most convictions. The t-test compared the last two categories to decide that they had approximately equal convictions. However, the F-test could have shown that the last category had the least convictions, and t test could have shown that the first two categories were approximately equal.

Freedom of Information Act CIA document from June 1954.
Nerve War Against Individuals
The strength of any enemy (foreign or domestic, political or military) consists largely of the individuals who occupy key positions in the enemy organisation, as leaders, speakers, writers, organisers, cabinet members, senior government officials, army commanders and staff officers, and so forth. Any effort to defeat the enemy must therefore concentrate to a great extent upon these key enemy individuals.
If such an effort is made by means [of] short physical violence, we call it ""psychological warfare"". If it is focused upon convincing those individuals by logical reasoning, but primarily upon moving them in the desired direction by means of harassment, by frightening, confusing and misleading them, we speak of ""nerve war"". Such a nerve war can be waged against an entire nation or against major groups of the population. In the present paper, however, we discuss only nerve war against individuals, that is, against key personalities in the enemy camp.....http://cryptome.org/cia-nerve-war/cia-nerve-war.htm

The typically vacant stare of someone on drugs or alcohol is very similar to the stare of the TV watcher.""
""The brain is patterned by the senses, by movement, speech, thought and imagination. As the brain develops, children shift from a non-verbal right hemisphere dreaming consciousness to a verbal, logical left hemisphere state. Television watching prolongs childrens dependency on the right hemisphere.""
""Children develop their sense of identity, of saying I to themselves in meeting real people. The people on TV are unreal, impersonal images which do little or nothing to awaken a childs sense of self. Hence TV children may tend to relate to themselves and others as things, objects, tools, or even machines. This attitude may later develop into an inability to react constructively in social situations.""

We have to escalate to defend Iraq from the outside intervention."" 
Then came the ""debate."" We are a free and open society, after all, so we have ""lively"" debates. On the one side were the hawks who said, ""The Iranians are interfering, we have to bomb them."" On the other side were the doves who said, ""We cannot be sure the evidence is correct, maybe you misread the serial numbers or maybe it is just the revolutionary guards and not the government."" 
So we had the usual kind of debate going on, which illustrates a very important and pervasive distinction between several types of propaganda systems. To take the ideal types, exaggerating a little: totalitarian states' propaganda is that you better accept it, or else. And ""or else"" can be of various consequences, depending on the nature of the state. People can actually believe whatever they want as long as they obey. Democratic societies use a different method: they don't articulate the party line. That's a mistake. What they do is presuppose it, then encourage vigorous debate within the framework of the party line. This serves two purposes. For one thing it gives the impression of a free and open society because, after all, we have lively debate. It also instills a propaganda line that becomes something you presuppose, like the air you breathe. http://www.informationclearinghouse....ticle19540.htm

Re: How We Get Brainwashed!


Fear Appeals
A few decades ago fear appeals were made to the white Western people about overpopulation. Whites immediately began to have fewer children. It worked. What they did not tell us whites was that they planned to flood the white world with overpopulating non-whites in order to replace us.
Other examples of fear appeals and how they work from http://www.propagandacritic.com/arti...t.sa.fear.html .
Quote:

* Fear appeals will not succeed in altering behavior if the audience feels powerless to change the situation.
* Fear appeals are more likely to succeed in changing behavior if they contain specific recommendations for reducing the threat that the audience believes are both effective and doable. 
In summary, there are four elements to a successful fear appeal: 1) a threat, 2) a specific recommendation about how the audience should behave, 3) audience perception that the recommendation will be effective in addressing the threat, and 4) audience perception that they are capable of performing the recommended behavior.
When fear appeals do not include all four elements, they are likely to fail. Pratkanis and Aronson provide the example of the anti-nuclear movement, which successfully aroused public fear of nuclear war, but offered few specific recommendations that people perceived as effective or doable. By contrast, fall-out shelters were enormously popular during the 1950s because people believed that shelters would protect them from nuclear war, and installing a shelter was something that they could do.
In a similar fashion, during the 1964 campaign, Lyndon Johnson was said to have swayed many voters with a well-known television commercial that portrayed a young girl being annihilated in a nuclear blast. This commercial linked nuclear war to Barry Goldwater (Johnson's opponent), and proposed a vote for Johnson as an effective, doable way of avoiding the threat.

Endless woe! Look at the sickness which the Episcopal Church is spreading:
Quote:

here are answers to three questions basic to anti-racism training:
* What is Prejudice?
 preconceived judgment or opinion; an adverse opinion or leaning formed without just grounds or before sufficient knowledge; . . . an irrational attitude of hostility directed against an individual, a group, a race, or their supposed characteristics . (Websters Ninth New Collegiate Dictionary, Merriam-Webster, 1983)
* What is Racism?
 Racism is more than race prejudice. It is more than individual attitudes and actions. Racism is the collective actions of a dominant racial group. Systemic power turns race prejudice into racism. Racial prejudice becomes racism when one groups racial prejudices are enforced by the systems and institutions of a society, giving power and privilege based on skin color to the group in power, and limiting the power and privilege of the racial groups that are not in power. (Dismantling Racism: The Continuing Challenge to White America, Crossroads Ministry, 1991)
* Who is a Racist?
All white individuals in our society are racists. Even if whites are totally free from all con scious racial prejudices, they remain racists, for they receive benefits distributed by a white society through its institutions. Our institutional and cultural processes are so arranged as to automatically benefit whites, just because they are white. It is essential for whites to recognize that they receive most of these racist benefits automatically, unconsciously, and unintentionally.(Education and Racism, National Education Association, 1973) 
A. In the light of the foregoing definitions, write an essay oftwo and a half pages describing the role the Episcopal Church has played and continues to play in perpetuating and/or combating institutional racism. As part of your essay, give at least three specific examples from your knowledge of the Episcopal Church and three from your own personal experience.


http://www.episcopalchurch.org/1521_6891_ENG_HTM.htm

About Springmeier? Sure. I read most of his stuff. -- Well, I didn't go through all the deprogramming stuff in much detail. I got the gist of it, and a little more. And I did read Bloodlines of the Illuminati cover to cover, I believe. As I remember it. It was quite a while back. Maybe in 2003 or so. And he has some other interesting stuff. About the Watchtower. And Disney. Snow White is pure Satanism. Okay.
I don't know if the guy is just tripping out, or what. But he was the son of Navy Intelligence, as I said. Which fact seems to have been removed from the net. I imagine there's a certain degree of truth in some of the links he draws. But I would defy anyone to show me something ""Satanic"" in Snow White. -- Seven dwarfs? Their names? Grumpy? What? This is not hard evidence of wrongdoing.
What I'm saying is -- Well, first of all, there's no such thing as an ""Illuminati."" I've never seen anything but pure fiction to support the idea that there are people in the modern world that run around in robes and call themselves Illuminati. There was a group called Les Alumbrados, from Spain, the 14 Century or some time. And there was, what I and good conspiracy buddy of mine believe, was a Freemasonic plot, and/or a complete fabrication. This story of Adam Weishaupt, and his plan to out-Freemason the Freemasons in deception. You notice that none of the other governments of Europe took any action on this warning from the Bavarian government. And I would say, that's because they knew the whole thing was pure invention.
Alternatively, the story of the courier might be true, and the papers he was carrying actually did exist. But here's a guy who was ""struck by lightning."" And that's the real tip off. If it happened at all, then in reality, all they did was get some stooge, kill him, stuff a bag of gunpowder in his pocket and light it up. Nobody would have had a real forensic knowledge of that a lightning burn looked like back then.
And then you have these people who are implicated in this big conspiracy, and all those people get their houses raided. So I would think, it was a Freemasonic purge, to get rid of some undesireables, either within their own ranks or without. And then they do it in a way that has a typical Freemasonic type joke to it. Like saying, ""Oh yeah, we're -- this Illuminati group -- we're so bad even God hates us! That's how bad we are.""
So it's a big joke, and the only support it has, besides the supposed records in the government archive somewhere that nobody gets to read, are these two books by Burrell and Robison, and a few sermons by Morse. All of whom could have been spinning a yarn, just like you have people spinning yarns today.
As to how I know Cathy O'Brien is a fraud, you just sort of get a sixth sense for this after long enough. Doesn't sound very scientific, but you see enough b.s., after a while you get a b.s. spidey sense. O'Brien is just completely goofy. But playing the real serious dame in her little drama there on the podium. And you'd have to have Springmeier in on this stuff, since he's writing books with that other woman, claiming to have spent hours and hours deprogramming people in their house. Where he gets time for researching fat books and growing pot, one wonders.
Here's an example of what Naval Intelligence people do. Compare Chapter 2 of Ramsey's The Nameless War, published 1952:http://www.sweetliberty.org/issues/w...meless/2.shtml
with Chapter 3 of Carr's endlessly touted Pawns in the Game, published 1958:http://yamaguchy.netfirms.com/789740...wns_index.html
Utterly shameless plageurism, but with ""Illuminati"" instead of jews. In Pawns, for example, jewish Bolsheviks are the victims of the sinister Illuminati. Cry me a river.
So eventually you've read pretty much the whole body of the conspiracy literature, which isn't very much, and you find out where people are ripping their shiz off of. It's just a course you can take yourself through, like anything else, and it's what they teach in intelligence academies to the operatives in charge of wasting people's time. Getting them to spin their wheels endlessly in this maze of Illuminati nonsense.
Show me the Illuminati. Where they at? Except in these books in the New Age section. Show me the proof from some court case or whatever out in the real world. Not some tale from Ted Gunderson, who's actually a Fed finding out how much victim's families know, doing damage control. Where's the evidence of the satin robed guys?
So that part is scientific. You can't prove there's an Illuminati. You've got Bohemian Grove, but that's it. Where the other footage? Where do these ceremonies happen? I think witchcraft is a lot more sophisticated than that today. It's a technological witchcraft.

Quote:

Albrecht writes that the dominant components of solastalgia include the loss of ecosystem health and corresponding sense of place, threats to personal health and wellbeing and a sense of injustice and/or powerlessness.
Solastalgia is classified as a psychoterratic illness, or one in which environmental damage is associated with mental distress.
Research demonstrates a profound impact on mental health and sense of well-being in those who suffer profound changes in their home environments. I

The rapid change of the social home environment combined with the slurs of being evil ""racists"" is actually making us feel mentally and physically ill.
Quote:

The flood of non-white immigration in the United States, Europe, Australia, and other white nations has, and continues to have, an erosive effect on white communities. Immigrants who are in the out-group relative to the majority population move into neighborhoods and rapidly alter the social landscape. Days at school, trips to the store, or nights out on the weekend no longer become community-affirming experiences but are filled with language barriers, fear, and a palpable tension. These feelings manifest themselves in the well-known phenomenon of 'white flight'. As the non-white population of an area increases, whites tend to move out of the area in an attempt to join or build racially homogenous communities elsewhere. But in both the United States and Europe, whites are running out of places to go.

1. As for what you say that the King of Spain obliges you to become Christians: do it, since you cannot do otherwise. 
2. As for what you say about the command to despoil you of your property: make your sons merchants that they may despoil, little by little, the Christians of theirs. 
3. As for what you say about making attempts on your lives: make your sons doctors and apothecaries, that they may take away Christian's lives. 
4. As for what you say of their destroying your synagogues: make your sons canons and clerics in order that they may destroy their churches. 
5. As for the other vexations you complain of: arrange that your sons become advocates and lawyers, and see that they always mix in affairs of State, that by putting Christians under your yoke you may dominate the world and be avenged on them. 
6. Do not swerve from this order that we give you, because you will find by experience that, humiliated as you are, you will reach the actuality of power. 
(Signed) Prince of the Jews of Constantinople""
(Julio-Inigrez de Medrano - ""La Silva Curiosa"" 1608 my emphasis)

OdinsWolves	4/28/2008	5:27 PM	"


Waking Up!


Who We Are NotNot one of us, during the course of our lives, has been immune to the unbelievably powerful Etinic/Thursic forces that compete for our minds. We are literally bombarded with misinformation from our very first day onward by those who wish to control our worldview. Some of the outside influences, like parents, family and friends, do this innocently enough, believing they have our best interests in mind. The problem is that they, too, have been indoctrinated to believe a variety of false views. They are all too happy to pass along their own indoctrinated false worldview. Others, however, are quite sophisticated in this regard, knowingly shaping your mind to conform to their well-planned agendas. Academia, politicians, religions, and corporate media fall under this category. There are many additional levels within this spectrum, but they all add up to the same thing for the vast majority- deep sleep.In order to wake up, one must endure the long hard road of Work under the direction of conscious Will. To begin this process, a person must first realize that they have been asleep, and then work to develop a pristine clarity based upon their own deep investigation into the nature of self and reality. Otherwise, they will remain deeply asleep; a bundle of programmed, reactionary responses to whatever outside stimuli comes along. One can easily go through an entire lifetime automatically reacting through every experience this way. Far from being who they have falsely convinced themselves to be, they are actually the walking dead, wholly indoctrinated, trapped within an inherited conceptual framework, projecting his reality (or his parents, his teachers, the medias, etc.) out into the world, which is completely free of his projections and always has been. In this way, one may travel from the cradle to the grave having never known that they were never genuinely alive. How can one create perceived reality, especially when so asleep? The answer to this question is obvious to some, while others remain completely oblivious to it. Some are convinced they understand, but in reality they only believe in a conceptual idea about it that they have read or heard somewhere. To know, one has to do the work involved. Without experiential knowledge, it is just another indoctrinated viewpoint. Whether or not one is aware of it, consciousness not only takes in the perceived outside reality, but it also projects out personal meaning based upon an internal conceptual framework. For example, if I were to hold up a cigarette and ask, Can you prove to me that this cigarette is real? you might find that to be an odd question. You might say, Of course its real. Youre holding it right there in your hand arent you?. From a certain perspective, that would be absolutely true, and I would seem a bit odd for even asking the question in the first place. Lets look closer. In fact, lets look very closely at this object in my hand. What is it? Looking closely, I see there is some paper, some tobacco, and a filter. What we have labeled paper is actually wood pulp from a tree. Nothing is inherently cigarette about that. Looking closely at what we have labeled tobacco, I realize there is nothing inherently cigarette about that, either. There is nothing inherently cigarette about the cotton that we have labeled filter, either. (For that matter, looking very deeply, I realize that wood pulp, tobacco, and cotton are just more labels. What are they?) The truth is, the cigarette doesnt exist as the object I am holding in my hand. It only exists as a conceptual idea within my own mind. I project cigarette-ness into the object, and therefore interact with objective reality to create the cigarette. The actual object in my hand is completely Empty of my projections. There is nothing cigarette about it, whatsoever. To take the analogy further, once I have created the cigarette, then due to my indoctrination, I know that I am supposed to stick one end of it into my mouth, set the other end on fire, and suck smoke through it. If I had been born on a deserted island where I had never been introduced to the idea of cigarette, and then found this object, would I have any idea what I was supposed to do with it? I might just as well eat the thing! From one level of awareness, the act of smoking a cigarette is a simple, mundane aspect of obvious, physical reality. From a deeper level of Awareness, I recognize that I have projected meaning into a mysterious conglomeration of unknown substances. Then, based on a conceptual framework I had been indoctrinated with from various outside sources, I have performed an action within objective reality (smoking). Now, take this overly simplistic example of looking deeply into the nature of the cigarette, and apply it to everything you perceive, from the most mundane aspects of your physical, mental, and emotional life to the most complex concepts you hold about the nature of self and reality. You will find that you label both subjective and objective reality based upon completely false conceptualizations that you have been indoctrinated with your entire life. You must free yourself! Reality is not what you think it is! Reality is what actually IS, once you have escaped the cage of your mental framework. You must open the door of your conceptual cage, your limited, indoctrinated worldview, and for once (at last) look out upon the wonder that actually is your birthright. For this to happen, you must do the work of destroying the erroneous concept of your own (false) identity and worldview, and wake up to what actually is. Just as Odin destroys Ymir in order to reformulate the universe, you must destroy and recreate yourself as a god-like being. Like Odin, we must give self to Self. We must take up the Runes and seek the Mysteries! The process of destroying the false self and waking up to the real (Initiated) Self, is not about clearing up the Mystery. Its about making the Mystery clear! And to do this, one need look no further than within ones self. When one has done the work of Awakening, they have realized a level of being that brings genuine life to our Tradition. They are not only informed by our ancestral ways, they embody it!

yes, indeed. they sure do. all the print media, 
but also entertainment, advertisements, and the 
'news'. we have been taught to accept and not 
question authority'. it's insidious. and it starts 
at a very early age. 
""any effort aimed at instilling certain attitudes 
and beliefs in a person""
i believe the torture people (of both genders) 
experience at birth sets a TONE for what to expect 
on planet earth? bright lights, loud noises, harsh 
voices, harsh hands, cold metal, caustic chemicals. 
probably most of us have had that experience. 
and so we then assumed it was 'natural' and 
'normal' -- never questioning it. 
and THAT -- of course, began with a 'warning' in 
the OT that birth was to be a DIFFICULT thing for 
women. i have known women who say the 
opposite... that it's been the greatest pleasure 
they've ever experienced. think about it. 
they are the ones who have natural births. they 
are the ones who bond TIGHTLY and DEEPLY with 
their children... for LIFE! i have even seen mothers 
who had one child the hospital way -- and did not 
bond with that child -- but who had another the 
natural way and DID bond with that child. 
interesting. 
a baby who is born naturally has a trust of himself, 
his mother, and of the goodness of life. a baby 
who is not tortured by circumcision has a smile 
that comes easily, naturally and fully... look at 
photos of babies who were c'd... they look have a 
look of betrayal, fear. it has been said babies will 
blame a mother for any harm that comes to them 
because the unspoken agreement between mothers 
and children is 'mothers protect their babies'. the 
amount of misogyny (and porn) spread by 
circumcising cultures bears that out. 
when a wedge is driven between mother and child, 
a HUGE shift occurs in the natural order of things. 
a tendency toward misogyny, a cynicism about 
'love', a fixation on reproductive anatomy, the 
baby is born in FEAR, not LOVE and it shows for 
the rest of his/her life until/unless healing occurs. 
what about body language? how 'conditioning' 
can that be? every bit as effective as words... 
i have a book about 'DISGUST' -- and how 
manipulative that is. shame. blame. guilt. 
ostracism. postures of superiority. silencing 
discussion. this all is non-verbal, yet very 
effective in brainwashing/control/manipulation. 
mothers use them well... as do fathers... yet 
they are rampant in advertising, in education, 
and the media. mothers know how to gain 
compliance with a look, a posture. so do 
advertising moguls. doctors. politicians... 
look at the tone of voice in the debates... do 
we want someone who treats us like our father 
did? or how our mother did? either way, we 
are not treated as peers, as an intelligent 
powerful people -- but as peasants, underlings. 
german psychologist alice miller says hitler 
succeeded because he served as a father figure.
he treated the germans like their fathers did. 
look at our own leaders. how many of us 
are looking for an alcoholic father who can't talk 
logically, who slurs his words and issues demands 
and yet is a fun guy to have a beer (and pretzels) 
with? apparently quite a few. 
so whether it's verbal or not, there is still a lot 
of mind-control going on. and we've been 
conditioned to respond to it. 
a big 'brainwashing' we have received is that 
male babies don't deserve the same loving care 
and protection as female babies. men have 
learned their lives mean little... they are willing 
to go to war to kill and be killed... they commit 
suicide 4x as often as females... they kill each 
other, beat on each other... very strange behavior
for any warm-blooded creature -- but it is not 
natural -- it has been learned. no other species 
kills for fun and entertainment -- for FOOD, 
maybe, for SELF-PRESERVATION, maybe... 
but not for fun and games. 
people in europe do not circumcise -- they are 
SHOCKED when they hear americans circ. they 
consider it an abomination... so would have our 
great-grandparents... but we have been 
brainwashed to assume it is 'normal' to remove 
healthy skin from the reproductive systems of 
infant males and that there are 'good reasons' 
why to cut foreskins. ?????? 
are there other effects of traumatizing babies? 
i think so. the scores on verbal 
exams in europe show that european males and 
females are similarly endowed... not in the US. 
males here score lower than females. is it a 
'male' thing? or a PTSD thing? 
europeans are also loathe to go to war... they 
would not join in the 'fun' in iraq... connection? 
no less of a connection than to realize that the 
three cultures at war in the middle east are the 
ONLY three that circumcise their young: jews, 
english-speaking christians and muslims. 
when men are not valued, they do not value 
themselves, they do not value life, and they do 
not value women. 
non-verbal brainwashing has harmed a lot of 
people. our entire culture believes 1) baby boys 
don't deserve the same protection as baby girls 
2) medical 'authorities' should not be questioned 
and know best 3) violence is a legitimate way to 
solve problems. it's all brainwashing. and 
ultimately very profitable for the medical system, 
very profitable for the military industrial complex, 
very profitable for anyone who wants to control us. 
to gain perspective on the matter, close your eyes 
and imagine yourself in a natural world where people 
are simply born of the mother as easily as animals 
give birth... i've seen it happen -- imagine a world 
where babies are protected from all harm and 
kept in the arms of the mother for years... held, 
breast fed, smiles, laughter, lots of attention... 
and then look at an american hospital birth and 
a circumcision -- voila! -- instant, lifelong PTSD!!! -- 
then picture a home where a brand new circumcised 
baby is still hurting every time he is touched, each 
time a diaper comes in touch with his wound, every 
time he urinates or defecates, every move, even 
breathing. he is kept in a little bed with prison bars, 
apart from the parents. both parents go to work all 
day and baby is left with people who he has no 
connection with. his crying, from his pain and fear 
are assumed to be 'bad', for crying.
then he is sent to a school where 
he is indoctrinated in a myriad of ways... he's 
been set up for a life of feeling unloved, un-cared 
for, for withdrawing or lashing out in anger -- and 
also set up for believing in what he is told... 
for he has no inner reservoir. he does not know he 
is loved. he does not feel protected, but vulnerable. 
very effective nonverbal brainwashing, if you ask me. 
and a LOT of healing is called for. it's time to rethink 
the whole social structure, beginning with the first 
breath, all the way to the last. the very natural 
order of things has been drastically distorted over 
the past 150 years, due to the growth of the medical 
system's influence and over the past 60 years, 
circumcision has drastically changed what being 
""male"" means. we now assume 'male' means 
abusive, reckless, angry, violent. what happened? 
it's not just been verbal brainwashing, but all-the-
way-through brainwashing on a primal, feeling 
level... fear runs our world... and it's not an 
irrational fear, but a legitimate fear, based on 
the way babies are born and treated. 
this world is so far from natural! 
and we are so far from happy, healthy and wise. 
i look forward to the end of fear, for all.

Looking back, giving in to outside pressure when it went against my better senses, I have always regretted that in hindsight, even if I had no choice because the pressure came from my own parents. The good thing is that I felt no guilt because they were the cause of my regret.
Happy and lucky is the person who is not forced to succumb to negative pressures, or who has the strength to resist them altogether if they come from sources which have no authority over us.
How we deal with negative pressures which come from the government, organized group thinking, etc., is a matter of making outwardly choices which cause us the least harm for the time being. But our inner resistance will never ever stop us from being independent thinkers. When the opportunity comes where we can make a radical change, we will.

(Remember the little story about the apes in the cage with the bananas hung above a short set of steps?) I frequently wish, hope, wonder if the people at large will wake up, want to wake up. More and more, I believe people prefer their slumber and thus deserve the fate that it brings upon them. This is our people and is why I believe more and more we need divine help.
