"Brainwashing isn't some """"ah-ha"	" that is when it happened"""" kind of thing. It's a slow and gradual process."																										
It typically starts in childhood. The parents of the child	 being brainwashed themselves	 help to pass on their brainwashing to their children. I don't blame them	 they are simply ignorant.																								
As the child grows and interacts with other children in the process of being brainwashed	 their brainwashing continues. Then comes school	 where the brainwashing really kicks in. For twelve to fourteen years	 the brainwashing continues. Luckily	" we have the teenage years where the average person is more inclined to """"question everything"""""	 even the things they hold dear. For some	" college is the next brainwashing step where it really kicks in hard. Those who have been through college will call people like us """"uneducated hicks"""" or similar. They will look down their nose at those who didn't go to college because their brainwashing is typically complete by this point. They have become white-hating racially-blind excuses for humans with egos bigger than their value. Practically useless except as another cog in a corporate wheel somewhere."																					
Let's not forget the constant brainwashing and fear-mongering through all the media outlets. Every day	 multiple times a day	 we are told over and over how scared we should be and how much shame we should have and how bad we should feel.																									
Very few of us make it through all of this intact. Many of us fall into the traps and for a time live a life of later regret. However	 we eventually shake the brainwashing and realize just how bad everything is. Some of us simply give up and go about our lives keeping our mouth shut and our head down. Maybe even resorting to drugs or alcohol to numb the pain. Some of us get so pissed off that we act out and shout and rant and rave and end up locked up for doing something stupid. Some of us are lost in a sea of **** and not sure what to do or how to do it or if it's even worth the trouble.																										
Personally	 I believe our efforts are worth it. All hope is not yet lost. A trap many of us fall into is the trap of expecting instant returns on our labor. This doesn't usually happen. It can take a lifetime of struggle to see some improvement	 it just depends on what the work is and what you're trying to change. However	 if it takes a lifetime to make a positive change	 was it worth it? Someone can come in your footsteps and continue your work. We are not fighting for ourselves	 we are fighting for the future of our people. This is not a fight that can be won in a generation. This is going to take awhile. Don't beat yourself up if you see little progress. Progress is progress.																						
The very first step to take is to shake the brainwashing and learning to discern the facts from the fiction. There is so much crap out there. So much to wade through. It can be tiring. It took me ten years to shake all the brainwashing and another five to sort myself out enough to see clearly. I had my stumbling blocks. I made my mistakes.																											
I personally suggest every one of us should get rid of our televisions	 install ad-blocking in our browsers	 try to learn about and begin to use Linux	 and learn to see through the crap that is everywhere. Don't be afraid to take some time every day to just unwind and contemplate the next steps you should take	 or just unwind.																							
Based on my own research and experience	" """"we"""" need a solid professional media presence. The keyword here"	" professional. I know a lot of us are in the """"frustrated and damned pissed off"""" category"	 and rightly so. However	 throwing around racial slurs and raging openly makes you no better than the undesirables. Being calm	 collected	 educated	" and of good character will go a long way """"opening the eyes of the sheep"""". The goal at this point in time is to awaken as many as possible and help keep them from falling into old habits and helping to keep them from falling into the pissed-off category and getting themselves locked up. Such actions only hurt our cause. Violence is not going to work. Self-defense is encouraged but should be used wisely."																				
We are better than the ones we despise. We should strive to be the best we can be	 not just for ourselves	 but for all of us and the future generations. The government and schools are not going to take care of our kids	 or their kids	 if they even have any. We have to be shining examples of hope and love for our kind.																							
Back to the topic though	 the media and the educational system that is in place are the main sources of brainwashing. To combat this (neutralize it)	 we need our own forms of media and educational system.																									
Based on how modern humans are	 we probably should focus on delivering goods via visual media such as video. Professional educational videos. News via video. So on and so forth. The problem here is that producing such content takes time	 effort	 and skill. It is not a one-person job. You need a team of dedicated individuals to make such a thing a reality. To fund it	 those who have more money than time can donate to cover expenses such as equipment. Due to our low numbers (in comparison to the brainwashed)	 we may be better working out a decentralized media network.																						
For example	" let's take the USA. We could have """"stations"""" in each state. One """"station"""" per state. Each """"station"""" would have a team that would do their own media"	 interviews	 coverage	 articles	" etc for their state. Then there could be a central """"station"""" aimed more for """"national news"""" which could be shared with all the state stations so they can include such in their """"broadcasts"""" (which would be via the internet"	 maybe Bitchute or similar?). This set up could be mirrored for every country. In the early stages	 there may be gaps in coverage	 and funding may be hard to come by	 but with time	 effort	 and passion	 it could become a big thing. As well	" instead of """"just news"""""	 each station could also do wholesome and helpful media. The national station could do some stuff like that too and share it with the state stations. Imagine	 a decade from now	" we could potentially be producing our own """"TV shows"""" that are wholesome and full of the virtues that we all strive to have. We could be a major pain in the backside to the current media networks."											
Of course	 due to the foreseeable attempts to stop us	 it would be wise to consider ways of avoiding allowing them to take us down. This means avoiding video hosting sites that have horrible TOSs and AUPs	 keeping our media focused on love of our people	 wholesome values	 education	" and the like and avoiding spreading """"hate"""". We shouldn't be focusing on """"hating"""" the undesirables"	 but instead focusing on the love of our people. Hate begets hate. Love begets love.
